meanings.definition: The act of interpreting written or printed material.
meanings.sent1: Readding helps us understand stories better.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy readding books to learn new things.
meanings.sent3: After readding the map, we still got lost!
meanings.sent4: Her readding of the situation was completely wrong.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's readding of the poem was so engaging.

meanings.definition: The act of examining or studying written material.
meanings.sent1: Proper readding of the instructions is important.
meanings.sent2: Students spend hours readding their textbooks.
meanings.sent3: His readding of the menu made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The detective's readding of the evidence was meticulous.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's readding of the research paper was thorough.

meanings.definition: The act of looking at or perusing written material.
meanings.sent1: Quick readding of the signs helped us find our way.
meanings.sent2: I love readding magazines during my free time.
meanings.sent3: Her readding of the newspaper made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The traveler's readding of the map was swift.
meanings.sent5: The child's readding of the storybook was delightful.
